|noprose=yes }} 'The State' is the second album released by the Canadian rock
band Nickelback. "Leader of Men" was the lead single from this album followed by
"Old Enough", "Breathe" and "Worthy to Say". "Leader of Men" helped the band
gain mainstream popularity and mainstream audience by becoming a top ten in hit
America and becoming a top 20 hit in Canada. It held a peak position of #130 on
the Billboard 200. The album also held a peak position on Billboard Top
Heatseekers Albums charts position #3 in 2000. The album went Platinum in Canada
in April 2002 and went Platinum in 2008 in the United States, the album was
released in Europe in April 2001 but did not sell as well as in North America.
It is the band first album to featured their third drummer called Ryan Vikedal.
